current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend title 10, United States Code, to improve and
		  enhance the capabilities of the Armed Forces to prevent and respond to sexual
		  assault and sexual harassment in the Armed Forces, and for other
		  purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Military Sexual Assault Prevention Act
			 of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Prohibition on service
			 in the Armed Forces by individuals who have been convicted of a sexual
			 offense

header.#text:
Prohibition on
				service in the armed forces by individuals convicted of a sexual
				offense

under Federal or State law may not be
				processed for commissioning or permitted to enlist in the armed forces.

text.#text:
A person who has been convicted of an
				offense specified in

An offense specified in this
				paragraph is any felony offense as follows:
Rape.
Sexual assault.
Forcible sodomy.
Incest.

				discharge

and not punitively discharged from the armed forces in connection
				with such conviction shall be separated administratively from the armed forces
				for such offense.

header.#text:
Inclusion and
			 command review of information on sexual-related offenses in personnel service
			 records of members of the Armed Forces

Information on
			 substantiated reports on sexual-Related offenses

text.#text:
If a complaint of a sexual-related offense is made
			 against a member of the Armed Forces and the complaint is substantiated, a
			 notation to that effect shall be placed in the personnel service record of the
			 member, regardless of the member's grade.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is to alert commanders to the members of their command who have
			 received courts-martial conviction, non-judicial punishment, or administrative
			 action for sexual-related offenses in order to reduce the likelihood that
			 repeat offenses will escape the notice of commanders.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Military Sexual Assault Prevention Act of 2013/s:6/ss:a/p:1

text.#text:
The
			 purpose of the inclusion of information in personnel service records under

header.#text:
Collection and
			 retention of records on disposition of reports of sexual assault

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall require that the Secretary of each military
			 department establish a record on the disposition of any report of sexual
			 assault, whether such disposition is court-martial, non-judicial punishment, or
			 other administrative action. The record of any such disposition shall include
			 the following, as appropriate:

text.#text: The

Documentary
			 information collected about the incident reported.

Punishment
			 imposed, including the sentencing by judicial or non-judicial means including
			 incarceration, fines, restriction, and extra duty as a result of military
			 court-martial, Federal and local court and other sentencing, or any other
			 punishment imposed.

Reasons for the
			 selection of the disposition and punishments selected.

Administrative
			 actions taken, if any.

Any pertinent
			 referrals offered as a result of the incident (such as drug and alcohol
			 counseling and other types of counseling or intervention).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall require that—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for a period of not less than 50 years; and
